publicationStmt.publisher: Centre for Computing in the Humanities, King's College London

address.addrLine: Strand, London WC2R 2LS, England, United Kingdom. Tel:+44 (0) 20 7836 5454

availability.p: This resource is publicly available and free at the point of access and it is registered under a a Creative Commons license Attribution-Share Alike 3.0

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines at http://www.cch.kcl.ac.uk/xmod/about/encoding/

div.p: "Colloquy: high-level, serious discussion" (Webster's Ninth New Collegiate Dictionary): The items in this section of the website – unlike those under "Project Information," which are essentially administrative in nature – are intended to engage in discussion about the documents on the website and their content. It is thus "interpretive" in nature. Included in that category is the Bibliography, which serves the entire website.
The section is designed to hold, in the future, short essays, draft articles, perhaps also the texts of papers delivered at conferences and not yet published.
